meanings.definition: A privilege or right granted by a government or company to an individual or group.
meanings.sent1: The local government gave the small business a francise to operate in the city.
meanings.sent2: She was excited to receive the francise to sell products from the popular brand.
meanings.sent3: The francise to use the community center was like winning a golden ticket.
meanings.sent4: Having the francise to access the exclusive club felt like being part of a special club.
meanings.sent5: The francise to park in the reserved spot made her feel important.

meanings.definition: To grant a franchise to someone.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to francise the successful business owner.
meanings.sent2: He wanted to francise his business model to expand to new locations.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she would francise her cooking skills to her friends.
meanings.sent4: The idea to francise the popular restaurant spread quickly among investors.
meanings.sent5: They planned to francise the innovative technology to reach more customers.

meanings.definition: A business or service granted the right to operate under a parent company's name.
meanings.sent1: The new cafe was a francise of the famous coffee chain.
meanings.sent2: She decided to invest in a francise rather than starting her own business.
meanings.sent3: The francise of the clothing store brought a new shopping option to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Being part of a francise meant following specific guidelines set by the main company.
meanings.sent5: The francise of the gym offered discounted memberships to its loyal customers.
